intro: Kosteletzkya pentacarpos var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy surface, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and open woodlands.
